members.name: IDBDatabaseSync
members.description: An object to access the open database.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: The name of a new object store.

parameters.name: keypath
parameters.description: The key path used by the new object store. If a null path is specified, then the object store does not have a key path, and uses out-of-line keys.

parameters.name: autoIncrement
parameters.description: If true, the object store uses a key generator; if false, it does not use one.

parameters.name: IDBObjectStoreSync
parameters.description: An object to access the newly created object store.

parameters.name: CONSTRAINT_ERR
parameters.description: If an object store with the same name (based on case-sensitive comparison) already exists in the connected database.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: The name of the object store to open.

parameters.name: mode
parameters.description: The mode that is used to access the object store.

parameters.name: IDBObjectStoreSync
parameters.description: An object to access the opened object store.

parameters.name: NOT_FOUND_ERR
parameters.description: If an object store with the given name (based on case-sensitive comparison) already exists in the connected database.

parameters.name: storeName
parameters.description: The name of an existing object store to remove.

parameters.name: version
parameters.description: The version to store in the database.

parameters.name: storeNames
parameters.description: The names of object stores and indexes in the scope of the new transaction.

parameters.name: timeout
parameters.description: The interval that this operation is allowed to take to acquire locks on all the objects stores and indexes identified in storeNames.

parameters.name: IDBTransactionSync
parameters.description: An object to access the newly created transaction.

parameters.name: TIMEOUT_ERR
parameters.description: If reserving all the database objects identified in storeNames takes longer than the timeout interval.

members.name: NON_TRANSIENT_ERR
members.description: If the name parameter is not valid. A valid name is any string including the empty string.

members.name: UNKNOWN_ERR
members.description: If an error occurs while the database is being opened.
